Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2007 12:45PM NadineS wrote: I had a lumpectomy and a re-excision.  My tumor 2.1 centimeters, at the 12 o'clock position in the left breast.  After the lumpectomy, I took a long time to take off the bandages (probably a good idea).  After the re-excision, I took off the bandages a lot sooner and almost felt faint because the top half looked so flat.  However, it filled in afterwards.  This was 1 1/2 years ago and the area of my excision and "tumor bed" are still a bit hard.  Also, when I had my lumpectomy, they had to remove section of skin (a quarter moon shape about 1/2 inch at the widest part) because the tumor had started to attach (although later showed that there was no involvement of the skin).  So, everything was pulled up about half an inch and possibly may have made it less likely that there would be an obvious dent.  I do have a large scar though, about 4 inches.  To some degree, it looks like a breast lift done the wrong way.  I am slightly smaller on that side and no longer "in alignment" with the other breast...although not particularly noticable.
